Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that David Brooks did not mention "assassinated" in his column or in his subsequent interview.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by adding the element of "assassinated" to Brooks' statement, which he did not actually say.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a disreputable website as the only source for the alleged comments.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based solely on a single source from a dubious website.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the alleged comments made by David Brooks are accurate, without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the alleged comments are fabricated by a disreputable website.
